cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 235 miles south of Panama City, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: continuing north-northwest across the eastern Gulf of Mexico, then turning north and moving inland across the western Florida Panhandle Monday afternoon/evening before lifting north-northeast through Alabama, Georgia and the southern Appalachians
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: western Florida Panhandle (near or east of Panama City, FL)

weather_observation.watch_coast: N/A – watches confined to Florida Panhandle coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: Florida Panhandle coast from Navarre to the Wakulla/Jefferson County line (tropical-storm warning); Indian Pass to Yankeetown (storm-surge warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Alabama border eastward to Florida Big Bend
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None listed within wind-probability table – nearest stations are in GA/FL/AL far to the south
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely (current guidance keeps heaviest rain south and east of the port)
weather_observation.wind: Only occasional gusty showers possible; sustained tropical-storm-force winds not expected
weather_observation.storm_surge: None – port is on Lake Erie, well inland from the Gulf surge zone
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of remnant tropical moisture could bring 1–2 inches of rain Wednesday–Thursday, locally higher if the core track shifts north, but widespread flooding rainfall is not currently forecast
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief thunderstorm squalls and isolated tornado threat south of the port; no direct severe hazard anticipated at Toledo
